Rule.Name: sExcelPR
Rule.Title: The build number for Excel.exe indicates a Private Release (PR) build and this is an unsupported configuration
Rule.Text: The build number for Excel.exe '{0}' indicates a Private Release (PR) build. PR builds are intended only for testing and not production use. Please install the latest publicly available update.

Rule.Name: sNoIRMExcel2007
Rule.Query: $n2DigitVersion=12 and not($SKU2007='0011' or $SKU2007='0016' or $SKU2007='002E' or $SKU2007='0030') and not($SKU2007='')
Rule.Title: {0} doesn't support Information Rights Management
Rule.Text: You have {0} installed. It does not support the Information Rights Management feature.

Rule.Name: sNoIRMExcel2010
Rule.Title: {0} doesn't support Information Rights Management
Rule.Text: You have {0} installed. It does not support the Information Rights Management feature.

Object.Key4: Name LIKE '%Office 14, Office%' AND ProductKeyID LIKE '%%PID%%'

Rule.Name: sNoIRMExcel201064
Rule.Title: {0} doesn't support Information Rights Management
Rule.Text: You have {0} installed. It does not support the Information Rights Management feature.

Object.Key4: Name LIKE '%Office 14, Office%' AND ProductKeyID LIKE '%%PID%%'

Rule.Name: sNoIRMExcel2013
Rule.Query: contains('%PRODUCTCODE%','0FF1CE') and $n2DigitVersion=15 and not(($SKU2013='0011' and ($ReleaseType2013='1' or $ReleaseType2013='0')) or $SKU2013='0016')
Rule.Title: {0} doesn't support Information Rights Management
Rule.Text: You have {0} installed. It does not support the Information Rights Management feature.

Rule.Name: sNoIRMExcel201364
Rule.Query: contains('%PRODUCTCODE%','0FF1CE') and $n2DigitVersion=15 and not(($SKU201364='0011' and ($ReleaseType201364='1' or $ReleaseType201364='0')) or $SKU201364='0016')
Rule.Title: {0} doesn't support Information Rights Management
Rule.Text: You have {0} installed. It does not support the Information Rights Management feature.

Rule.Name: sNoIRMC2RExcel2013
Rule.Title: {0} doesn't support Information Rights Management
Rule.Text: You have {0} installed. It does not support the Information Rights Management feature.

Object.Name: Office 2013 Modern Authentication support for Office 365

Rule.Name: fKB2956145Installed
Rule.Text: {1} (or later) is{0}installed

Rule.Name: sAdalEnabled
Rule.Title: All prerequisites for ADAL are{0}installed

Rule.Name: sPDFMakerExcel14
Rule.Title: An incompatible version of the PDFMaker add-in is installed
Rule.Text: You have a version ({0}) of the PDFMaker add-in installed that is not compatible with Excel. Please update the add-in to version 10 or higher. http://helpx.adobe.com/acrobat/kb/compatible-web-browsers-pdfmaker-applications.html

Rule.Name: sPDFMakerExcel14x64
Rule.Query: $n2DigitVersion=14 and $bitness='x64' and versioncompare($.,'10.1.0.0')<0 and ($hkcuPDFMaker or $hklmPDFMaker or $hklmWowPDFMaker)
Rule.Title: An incompatible version of the PDFMaker add-in is installed
Rule.Text: The Adobe PDFMaker add-in was found on a computer that also has a 64-bit install of Office. The PDFMaker add-in version you have ({0}) is not supported with 64-bit versions of Office. http://helpx.adobe.com/acrobat/kb/compatible-web-browsers-pdfmaker-applications.html

Rule.Name: sPDFMakerExcel15
Rule.Title: An incompatible version of the PDFMaker add-in is installed
Rule.Text: You have a version ({0}) of the PDFMaker add-in installed that is not compatible with Excel. Please update the add-in to version 11.0.1 or higher. http://helpx.adobe.com/acrobat/kb/compatible-web-browsers-pdfmaker-applications.html

Rule.Name: sAddInLoadTimeDisplayHKCU
Rule.Text: Load time = {0}

Rule.Name: sAddInLoadTimeDisplayHKLM
Rule.Text: Load time = {0}

Rule.Name: sAddInLoadTimeDisplayWow
Rule.Text: Load time = {0}

Rule.Name: sXLDisabledPowerView
Rule.Title: The Power View add-in in Microsoft Excel 2013 is disabled
Rule.Text: The Power View add-in in Microsoft Excel 2013 is disabled and will not be loaded by Excel. This is a default COM add-in for Excel 2013, and it is used for interactive data visualization. Click Power View on the Insert tab to enable this add-in.

Rule.Name: sXLDisabledPowerPivot
Rule.Title: The PowerPivot add-in in Microsoft Excel 2013 is disabled
Rule.Text: The PowerPivot add-in in Microsoft Excel 2013 is disabled and will not be loaded by Excel. This is a default COM add-ins for Excel 2013, and it is used for powerful data analysis. Re-enable this add-in if you need this functionality in Excel.

Rule.Name: sXLDisabledInquire
Rule.Title: The Inquire add-in in Microsoft Excel 2013 is disabled
Rule.Text: The Inquire add-in in Microsoft Excel 2013 is disabled and will not be loaded by Excel. This is one of the default COM add-ins for Excel 2013, and it is used for workbook comparison and analysis. Re-enable this add-in if you need this functionality in Excel.

Rule.Name: sDisabledAddins
Rule.Title: Add-ins have been automatically disabled because of performance or stability issues
Rule.Text: Excel add-ins have been disabled due to performance or stability issues. To see the list of disabled add-ins, click the Configuration Details tile (above) and then search for 'Disabled Add-ins' using the Find feature.

Rule.Name: sUserReenabledAddins
Rule.Title: Problematic add-in(s) re-enabled by the user
Rule.Text: {0} add-in(s) disabled by Excel because of performance or stability issues was/were re-enabled by the user. To see the list of disabled add-ins that were re-enabled by the user, click the Configuration Details tile (above) and then search for 'DoNotDisableAddinList' using the Find feature.

Rule.Name: sFineReader9DetectedXL
Rule.Title: FineReader 9.0 add-in detected in the registry
Rule.Text: The FineReader add-in is installed. Older versions have been known to cause Excel to crash. Update or disable the FineReader add-in if you are experiencing crashes in Excel.

Rule.Name: sFineReader10DetectedXL
Rule.Title: FineReader 10.0 add-in detected in the registry
Rule.Text: The FineReader add-in is installed. Older versions have been known to cause Excel to crash. Update or disable the FineReader add-in if you are experiencing crashes in Excel.

Rule.Name: sFineReader11DetectedXL
Rule.Title: FineReader 11.0 add-in detected in the registry
Rule.Text: The FineReader add-in is installed. Older versions have been known to cause Excel to crash. Update or disable the FineReader add-in if you are experiencing crashes in Excel.

Rule.Name: sFineReader9DetectedXLWow
Rule.Title: FineReader 9.0 add-in detected in the registry
Rule.Text: The FineReader add-in is installed. Older versions have been known to cause Excel to crash. Update or disable the FineReader add-in if you are experiencing crashes in Excel.

Rule.Name: sFineReader10DetectedXLWow
Rule.Title: FineReader 10.0 add-in detected in the registry
Rule.Text: The FineReader add-in is installed. Older versions have been known to cause Excel to crash. Update or disable the FineReader add-in if you are experiencing crashes in Excel.

Rule.Name: sFineReader11DetectedXLWow
Rule.Title: FineReader 11.0 add-in detected in the registry
Rule.Text: The FineReader add-in is installed. Older versions have been known to cause Excel to crash. Update or disable the FineReader add-in if you are experiencing crashes in Excel.

Rule.Name: sDisableRobustifiedUNC
Rule.Title: DisableRobustifiedUNC=1
Rule.Text: This registry value is only intended for troubleshooting purpose and is not supported in production environment.

Rule.Name: sCellSelectionNoMove
Rule.Title: The cell selection will not move down after you press Enter
Rule.Text: You have configured Excel to not move down to the next cell after you press Enter. Your configuration either does not change cells, or the cell to the left, right, or above will be selected when you press Enter.

Rule.Name: sIgnoreOtherApps
Rule.Title: The 'Ignore other applications that use Dynamic Data Exchange (DDE)' setting is enabled
Rule.Text:
When the 'Ignore other applications that use Dynamic Data Exchange (DDE)' setting is enabled, you will receive an error if you try to open an Excel file by double-clicking it.
Note, if you click the 'Fix it for me' option you may have to manually re-enable some settings in Excel.

Rule.Name: sFullCalcOnLoadOldFile
Rule.Title: Re-calculation of older workbooks may be affected by registry data
Rule.Text: Registry data that stops the initial calculation of external links that may no longer be available has been found. This keeps existing cell values intact, but is not recommended because further calculation results in the file may be wrong.

Rule.Name: sHkcuVBAOff
Rule.Title: VBA functionality is impaired or disabled (HKCU registry data)
Rule.Text: The VBAOff value in the HKCU registry hive is set to a value other than 0. In this configuration, Visual Basic for Applications (VBA) is disabled in Office programs. Set VBAOff=0 if you need to use VBA.

Rule.Name: sHklmVBAOff
Rule.Title: Visual Basic for Applications is disabled (HKLM registry data)
Rule.Text: The VBAOff value = 1 in the registry under the HKLM hive. In this configuration, Visual Basic for Applications (VBA) is disabled in Office programs. Set VBAOff=0 if you need to use VBA.

Rule.Name: sFileOpenBlankWindow
Rule.Title: Excel files do not open when double-clicked (error: 'There was a problem sending the command to the program.')
Rule.Text: When you double-click an Excel file to open it, Microsoft Excel starts but the file does not open. In addition, you receive the error 'There was a problem sending the command to the program.'. Please click the 'Click here ...' link and then install the update provided in the article.

Rule.Name: sCellSelectionNoMovePol
Rule.Title: The cell selection will not move down after you press Enter due to group policy settings
Rule.Text: The movement of the cell selection in Excel is being managed by group policy. The current policy settings prevent the cell selection from moving down when you press Enter. Please see your administrator to have this setting modified.

Rule.Name: sIgnoreOtherAppsPol
Rule.Title: The 'Ignore other applications that use Dynamic Data Exchange (DDE)' setting is enabled by group policy
Rule.Text: When the 'Ignore other applications that use Dynamic Data Exchange (DDE)' setting is enabled, you will receive an error if you try to open an Excel file by double-clicking it. Please see your administrator if you need to have the group policy for this feature modified.

Rule.Name: sHkcuVBAOffPol
Rule.Title: VBA Functionality is impaired or disabled due to Policy under HKCU
Rule.Text: The VBAOff value is set to a value other than 0 as a policy under HKCU. In this configuration, Visual Basic for Applications (VBA) is disabled in Office programs. Set VBAOff=0 if you need to use VBA.

Rule.Name: sHklmVBAOffPol
Rule.Title: VBA Functionality is impaired or disabled due to Policy under HKLM
Rule.Text: The VBAOff value is set to a value other than 0 as a policy under HKLM. In this configuration, Visual Basic for Applications (VBA) is disabled in Office programs. Set VBAOff=0 if you need to use VBA.

Object.Name: Application Event Log Entries for Last Excel crashes
Object.LogText: Collecting Application Event Log Entries for Last Excel crashes

Rule.Name: bucketLookup
Rule.Title: Event 1001

Rule.Name: sUnattendedAutomation
Rule.Title: Excel is detected to be working in non-user interactive mode through DCOM Settings
Rule.Text: Microsoft does not recommend, nor support, automation of Office applications from any unattended, non-interactive client application or component (including ASP, ASP.NET, DCOM, and NT Services).Please remove the DCOM settings for the Excel.

Rule.Name: sXLSXAutoFile
Rule.Title: File association for Excel incorrectly references "xlsx_auto_file"
Rule.Text: There is file association information in the Windows registry (under HKEY_CLASSES_ROOT) that associates Excel files with "xlsx_auto_file".

Rule.Name: sMissingNet4
Rule.Title: .NET Framework 4.0 or higher is not installed which is needed by the Inquire add-in
Rule.Text: The Inquire add-in for Excel 2013 requires the installation of .NET Framework 4.0 or higher. It is not installed on this computer, so the Inquire add-in will not function.

Rule.Name: sHKCRXLTemplate
Rule.Title: Default value under Excel.Template contains %1
Rule.Text: The (Default) value under HKEY_CLASSES_ROOT\Excel.Template\shell\Open\command contains %1. This has been known to cause startup problems in Excel.

Rule.Name: sHKCRXLTemplateMarcoEnabled
Rule.Title: Default value under Excel.TemplateMacroEnabled contains %1
Rule.Text: The (Default) value under HKEY_CLASSES_ROOT\Excel.TemplateMacroEnabled\shell\Open\command contains %1. This has been known to cause startup problems in Excel.

Rule.Name: sHKCRXLSheetMacroEnabled12
Rule.Title: Default value under Excel.SheetMacroEnabled.12 contains %1
Rule.Text: The (Default) value under HKEY_CLASSES_ROOT\Excel.SheetMacroEnabled.12\shell\Open\command contains %1. This has been known to cause startup problems in Excel.

Rule.Name: sHKCRXLSheet12
Rule.Title: Default value under Excel.Sheet.12 contains %1
Rule.Text: The (Default) value under HKEY_CLASSES_ROOT\Excel.Sheet.12\shell\Open\command contains %1. This has been known to cause startup problems in Excel.

Rule.Name: sHKCRXLSheet8
Rule.Title: Default value under Excel.Sheet.8 contains %1
Rule.Text: The (Default) value under HKEY_CLASSES_ROOT\Excel.Sheet.8\shell\Open\command contains %1. This has been known to cause startup problems in Excel.

Rule.Name: sHKCRXLSheetBinaryMacroEnabled12
Rule.Title: Default value under Excel.SheetBinaryMacroEnabled.12 contains %1
Rule.Text: The (Default) value under HKEY_CLASSES_ROOT\Excel.SheetBinaryMacroEnabled.12\shell\Open\command contains %1. This has been known to cause startup problems in Excel.

Rule.Name: sHKCRXLTemplate8
Rule.Title: Default value under Excel.Template.8 contains %1
Rule.Text: The (Default) value under HKEY_CLASSES_ROOT\Excel.Template.8\shell\Open\command contains %1. This has been known to cause startup problems in Excel.

Rule.Name: sXLAccessDBEngineX64PlusOfficeX86
Rule.Title: Unsupported configuration found: The 64-bit Microsoft Access database engine 2010 is installed along with a 32-bit version of Office 2010
Rule.Text: You have the 64-bit Microsoft Access database engine 2010 installed but you have a 32-bit version of Office 2010 installed. Mixing the 'bitness' of two Office products is not supported and can cause errors opening Excel files.
Rule.Symptoms: Configuration (unsupported or problematic),File Open error,Error message

Object.Name: Files in the Office Install XLStart Folder

Rule.Name: sFilesInXLStartFolderInstallPath
Rule.Title: At least one file with either .XLS or .XLA found in the {0}\XLStart folder
Rule.Text: At least one file with either .XLS or .XLA found in the {0}\XLStart folder. This can cause performance issues in Excel if these files have not been opened and saved in Excel 2007 or later.

Object.Name: Files in the APPDATA Excel Folder

Rule.Name: sFilesInXLFolderAppDataPath
Rule.Title: At least one file with either .XLS or .XLA found in the {0}\Microsoft\Excel folder
Rule.Text: At least one file with either .XLS or .XLA found in the {0}\Microsoft\Excel folder. This can cause performance issues in Excel if these files have not been opened and saved in Excel 2007 or later.

Object.Name: Files in the AltStartup Directory (Group Policy)

Rule.Name: sAltStartupPolicyPath
Rule.Title: At least one file with either .XLS or .XLA found in the folder specified by the AltStartup policy setting
Rule.Text: At least one file with either .XLS or .XLA was found in the folder ({0}) specified by the AltStartup group policy value in the registry. This can cause performance issues in Excel if these files have not been opened and saved in Excel 2007 or later.

Rule.Name: sAltStartupPath
Rule.Title: At least one file with either .XLS or .XLA found in the folder specified by AltStartup
Rule.Text: At least one file with either .XLS or .XLA was found in the folder ({0}) specified by the AltStartup value in the registry. This can cause performance issues in Excel if these files have not been opened and saved in Excel 2007 or later.
